workflow.name: Daily RSS feed summarizer with Gemini AI to Slack with X sharing option
workflow.description:
## How it works

This workflow fetches RSS feeds daily and sends a notification to Slack if new topics are found.

Since standard RSS snippets are often insufficient, the AI visits the source links to summarize the full articles and sends the summaries to Slack.
You can then share interesting topics directly to X from Slack using the button.

## How to use

* Open the **Gemini Chat Model** node (attached to the AI Agent) and set up the Credential.
  * You can obtain an API key from [Google AI Studio](https://aistudio.google.com/api-keys).
* Open the `Slack` node and set up the Credential to allow sending messages.
  * You can create a new Slack App [here](https://api.slack.com/apps).
* Finally, open the `Config` node and update the `rssUrls` parameter with the RSS feed URLs you want to follow.

## Customizing this workflow

* You can adjust the number of topics fetched per RSS feed by modifying the `takeCount` parameter in the `Config` node.

workflow.name: Summarize Daily RSS Feeds with AI and Send to Slack with X Sharing

parameters.content:
## How it works

This workflow fetches RSS feeds daily and sends a notification to Slack if new topics are found.

Since standard RSS snippets are often insufficient, the AI visits the source links to summarize the full articles and sends the summaries to Slack.
You can then share interesting topics directly to X from Slack using the button.

## How to use

* Open the **Gemini Chat Model** node (attached to the AI Agent) and set up the Credential.
  * You can obtain an API key from [Google AI Studio](https://aistudio.google.com/api-keys).
* Open the `Slack` node and set up the Credential to allow sending messages.
  * You can create a new Slack App [here](https://api.slack.com/apps).
* Finally, open the `Config` node and update the `rssUrls` parameter with the RSS feed URLs you want to follow.

## Customizing this workflow

* You can adjust the number of topics fetched per RSS feed by modifying the `takeCount` parameter in the `Config` node.

parameters.toolDescription: Get Page Content. Retrieves the content from the specified URL.

parameters.name: =User-Agent
parameters.value: =Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 14_5_0) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/129.0.6668.71 Safari/537.36

parameters.text:
=You are a professional Social Media Manager. Your task is to create engaging content for X (formerly Twitter) based on a news article.

Please follow these steps:
1. Use the provided `HttpRequestTool` to fetch the content from the following URL:
{{ $json.link }}

2. Based on the fetched content, generate a `title` and a `description`.
   - **title**: A concise and catchy headline for the article.
   - **description**: An engaging summary or comment suitable for an X post (informative, under 200 characters).

3. Output the result strictly in the JSON format shown below, enclosed in a code block. Do not include any other text.

```json
{
  "title": "Your Generated Title",
  "description": "Your Generated Description for X"
}
```

workflowId.cachedResultName: Summarize Daily RSS Feeds with AI and Send to Slack with X Sharing

parameters.content:
## Fetch RSS and Notify Slack
This is the main workflow. It fetches RSS feeds and sends notifications to Slack, calling a sub-workflow to process content with Generative AI.

## Summarize Articles with AI
Summarizes article content based on RSS URLs and formats the response for posting to X.

user.name: Hirokazu Kawamoto
user.bio: ‚òÜ Actively promoting n8n adoption in Japan! ‚òÜ I specialize in workflow optimization and AI integration using n8n. I also post daily updates about n8n. Check out my Note for more details.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Execute Workflow node can be used when you want your workflow to treat another workflow as a step in your flow. It allows you to modularize your workflows and have a single source of truth for series of actions you perform often.
The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
